Package edu.connect4

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.connect4.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game class manages the flow of the Connect 4 game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game​(Player p1, Player p2)
      Constructor for the Game class.

      Retrieves the winner of the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(Player p1,
            Player p2)
        Constructor for the Game class. Initializes a new game with two players and an empty board.
        Parameters:
        p1 - The first player who will take the initial turn in the game.
        p2 - The second player who will play after p1.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Starts the game by emptying the board and setting current player to player 1.

      • play

        public boolean play​(int column)
        Executes a play for the current player by dropping a disk in the given column. Move must be valid. Checks if the current player has won or if there is a tie.
        Parameters:
        column - The column number at which the current player wants to drop the disk. Must be an integer between 0 and 6 inclusive.
        Returns:
        true if the play is a success. false if the play is invalid (column is full or out of bounds) or if there is a tie.

      • getWinner

        public Player getWinner()
        Retrieves the winner of the game.
        Returns:
        the winning Player or null if the game ended in a tie.

      • checkGameOver

        public boolean checkGameOver()
        Checks if the game is over. If the game is over, it retrieves the winner and prints a message indicating whether a player has won or if the game has resulted in a tie.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over otherwise return false.

      • getBoardGrid

        public java.lang.String[][] getBoardGrid()
        Retrieves the current grid of the board. This method provides access to the current state of the Connect 4 board, represented as a 2D array of strings, where each element contains either a player's disk (represented by their color) or null for empty spots.
        Returns:
        A 2D array of strings representing the current grid of the board.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Retrieves the player whose turn it currently is in the Connect 4 game. This method returns the current player who is about to make a move. The game alternates between the two players after each valid move.
        Returns:
        The Player object representing the current player whose turn it is.
